cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
G.T.5822
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 28th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
On the Cambrai Battle Front we are reported to hold HIGHLAND RIDGE north of GON?LIEU, HARCOING, CAMTANG, FONTAINE NOTRE DAME, HAYNECOURT, and are on the CAMBRAI-DOUIA road F. of EPINOY, and are E. of OISY-LE-VERGER.
Over 10,000 prisoners and 200 guns captured.
E. of YPRES the 2nd Arrry attacked this morning with 4 Divisions. Our troops are reported to have taken PICCADILLY FAR., S. of ST. ELOI, MILL 60, BLUFF, HOOGE, and are of WEST HOEK.
The Belgians attacked and are reported to have taken POELGAPPELLE?, and are N. of VELDHOEK, CHATEAU 2,000 yards N. of VELDHOEK and ZANDHOEK.
1,200 prisoners reported so far captured by Belgians.
French Front.
Nothing to report.
2. ITALIAN, MACEDONIAN & PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff.
War Office, S.W.1.
28th September, 1918.
Issued at 12.45 p.m.
